docs.text:
DataSetTools


#


EconTools.descriptive_stats
 
 
Function
.


descriptive_stats(table,var::String,bycolumn::Tuple;weight=
None
)




Returns a new table containing  the mean, standard deviation, 1st, 2nd and 3rd quantiles of variable 
var
 by a selection of tuple of columns 
bycolumns
. Weights are optional and if specified, the function returns the weighted descriptive statistics.


For example 
descriptive_stats(data,"income",(:age,:gender),weight="sampling_weights")
 returns the descriptive statistics of income from table 
data
 by the columns name 
age
 and 
gender
, weighted by the sampling weights 
sampling_weights


source


#


EconTools.save_csv
 
 
Function
.


save_csv(path::String,table::DNextTable)




Saves table as CSV at the specified path. For example 
save_csv("Folder\data.csv",t)
 saves the table 
t
 in the subfolder 
Folder
 under the name 
data.csv


source

Weights are optional and if specified, the function returns the weighted descriptive statistics.  For example  descriptive_stats(data,"income",(:age,:gender),weight="sampling_weights")  returns the descriptive statistics of income from table  data  by the columns name  age  and  gender , weighted by the sampling weights  sampling_weights  source  #  EconTools.save_csv     Function .  save_csv(path::String,table::DNextTable)  Saves table as CSV at the specified path. For example  save_csv("Folder\data.csv",t)  saves the table  t  in the subfolder  Folder  under the name  data.csv  source

#


EconTools.scatterplot
 
 
Function
.


scatterplot(x,y)




Returns a scatter plot with a fitted line. The estimation uses GLM.jl


source
